description: From Middle English surenes; equivalent to sure +â€Ž -ness.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The property of being sure, certainty.
examples: His sureness was born of having looked it up in a reputable reference book.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The property of being sure, deft, confident of ability.
examples: The surgeon's sureness was the result of long study in school and long practice in the operating room, never did he hesitate and never was there a mis-move.

entries.meaning: (countable, rare) The result or product of being sure.
